titleStmt.title: Die Veneris, 26. Iulii, 1661. The Lords in Parliament taking notice, that the streets, lanes, and other publick passages in or near the citie of London and Westminster, and the liberties thereof, and especially in Holborn and the Lane commonly called St. Margarets Lane, leading to the Parliament-House as also the high-wayes about the said liberties of London and Westminster are very much out of repair:, It is ordered by the Lords in Parliament assembled, that the justices of peace ... take effectual care that the said streets, lanes, and high-ways, ... be speedily repaired according to law ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

titleStmt.title: Die Veneris, 26. Iulii, 1661. The Lords in Parliament taking notice, that the streets, lanes, and other publick passages in or near the citie of London and Westminster, and the liberties thereof, and especially in Holborn and the Lane commonly called St. Margarets Lane, leading to the Parliament-House as also the high-wayes about the said liberties of London and Westminster are very much out of repair:, It is ordered by the Lords in Parliament assembled, that the justices of peace ... take effectual care that the said streets, lanes, and high-ways, ... be speedily repaired according to law ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Majesty.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Initial; Steele notation: Arms 71 other wayes all.
At end of text: "Die Martis, 30 Die Julii 1661. Ordered by the Lords in Parliament, That this order be forthwith printed and published. Jo: Brown Cleric. Parliamentorum.".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
